property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: A service member greeting an Afghan leader with a hand over his heart

note.text: Many Afghans are aware of American greeting customs. Men will usually greet other men with a handshake. However, some counterparts, especially older ones, might prefer not to shake hands. Instead, they might greet with a hand over their heart and a slight bow of the head. Follow your counterpart's lead when greeting. If you're meeting a group, greet the oldest or highest-ranking person first.
